feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 8:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water In The Noatak And Kobuk Valleys... The Kobuk and Noatak Valleys have had 2 to 4 inches of rain so far this week, with another 1 to 2 inches of rain expected through Saturday morning. This is producing sharp rises on all rivers and streams in the Noatak and Kobuk Basins that will continue through the weekend. Large rivers such as the Kobuk and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 8:25AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Diminishing By This Afternoon... South winds of 15 to 25 mph will diminish through the morning with receding surge and decreasing wave action along the coast. Wave action is combining with storm surge to inundate some low lying areas, and push water above the normal High Tide Line this morning. South facing coastlines have seen storm surge values of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued August 26 at 9:12AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR PINAL COUNTY THROUGH MONDAY... The Pinal County Department of Air Quality has extended an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for Pinal County including Apache Junction, Casa Grande, Coolidge, and Florence through Monday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:46PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: Strong southerly winds could impact area travel this afternoon and early evening, across southwest Nebraska and much of northwest Kansas through 700 pm MDT/800 pm CDT. Gusts up to 50 mph are possible during this time and will impact high profile vehicles on east-west orientated roadways, especially Interstate 70. Drivers should use caution if out traveling during this time.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cheyenne; Decatur; Gove; Graham; Logan; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:46PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: Strong southerly winds could impact area travel this afternoon and early evening, across southwest Nebraska and much of northwest Kansas through 700 pm MDT/800 pm CDT. Gusts up to 50 mph are possible during this time and will impact high profile vehicles on east-west orientated roadways, especially Interstate 70. Drivers should use caution if out traveling during this time.

entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN CIBOLA COUNTY... entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Campbell County through 430 PM MDT... At 401 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Spotted Horse, or 42 miles northwest of Gillette, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:46PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Sublette County through 430 PM MDT... At 346 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles east of Marbleton, or 14 miles east of Big Piney, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:36PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Big Horn and northeastern Sheridan Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 335 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles northeast of Sheridan, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail, along with very heavy rainfall.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 3:33PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hot Springs and east central Fremont Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 330 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Hot Springs State Park, or 10 miles southeast of Thermopolis, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains West; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin

entry.title: Fire Weather Watch issued August 26 at 1:52PM MDT until August 27 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * IMPACTS: Low relative humidity and gusty west wind will create erratic fire behavior and quickly spread new fire starts. * AFFECTED AREA: In Central WY...Fire Weather Zones 280...283...and 300.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Natrona County, Casper BLM; Upper Wind River Basin, Wind River Basin
